pageContext.claim: “I looked at the audience; it was largely African American. I say, ‘Vote for me. What the hell do you have to lose?’ Remember? Right? And some of my people didn't like it, but I said, ‘I have to say it, because it's true.’ And they did vote for me and we won the race.”
pageContext.analysis: Laughably false. Hillary Clinton got 89 percent of the black vote in 2016, compared with a relatively minuscule 8 percent for Trump. A Washington Post-Ipsos poll released Jan. 17 found: "More than 8 in 10 black Americans say they believe Trump is a racist and that he has made racism a bigger problem in the country. Nine in 10 disapprove of his job performance overall."
